item.description:
The Hartford International Film Festival: Recession Edition (HIFF) rolls into town November 7-8, 2009. Showcasing films from the USA including CA, CT, and NE; Israel and Malaysia, this is the fourth year of this festival. The locations include The Art Cinema, The Studio at BillingsForge, La Paloma Sabenera, and the Red Rock Tavern.
SCHEDULE DAY 1

The fun begins at 5:30 pm with a Cocktail Party at the Firebox Restaurant, 539 Broad Street, Hartford, CT.

The opening film is at 7:30 pm at The Studio@Billings Forge, 563 Broad Street, Hartford. The film is "Woodpecker" with the short film "Blue Sky".

The second film is at 9:00 pm at The Studio@Billings Forge, 563 Broad Street, Hartford. The film is "Call Me If You Need Me" with the short film "Chasing Cats and Cars".

The third film of the night is 11:30pm at the The Art Cinema, 255 Franklin Avenue Hartford. The film is "Showgirls-Provincetown" with the short films "Mary May's Suicide Letter" and "LolliGirls: The Story Behind the Frills and Bows".

Price per screening is $7.00 and ALL FESTIVAL PASS is $20.00
item.name: Hartford International Film Festival: Recession Edition Day 1
